Dentistry: Can you tell us about your motivation for pursuing a career in dentistry?
Can you describe a time when you had to work effectively under pressure?
Can you tell us about a challenging situation you have faced and how you overcame it?
What do you think are the most important qualities of a good dentist?
How do you stay up-to-date with developments in dentistry and oral health?
How do you approach patient care and communication?
Can you describe a difficult ethical situation you have faced and how you resolved it?
How do you handle conflict with team members or patients?
Can you tell us about a research project you have undertaken or a paper you have read recently in the field of dentistry?
How would you prioritize tasks and manage your time effectively in a busy clinical setting?
What is the process of tooth decay and how can it be prevented?
Describe the different types of dental restorations and their indications.
How do you approach a patient with dental anxiety or phobia?
What is the role of a dentist in promoting oral hygiene and preventing dental caries?
In what ways do you consider the well-being and autonomy of your patients?
How do you envision promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion in your future dental practice?
Can you describe the different methods used for local anaesthesia in dentistry?
How do you plan to address and prevent medical errors in your practice?
In what ways do you consider the impact of your work on the environment and society?
In a situation where a patient requests a procedure that you believe is not in their best interest, how would you handle the situation?
In your opinion, what role should dentists play in promoting oral health and disease prevention for their patients?
What is the role of dental imaging technology in diagnosis and treatment planning?
What is the importance of dental research and how does it inform current clinical practices?
What is the purpose of root canal therapy and how is it performed?
What do you see as the most significant challenges facing the dental profession today?
What is the role of a dentist in promoting oral health and disease prevention for their patients?
Can you tell us about a recent development in dentistry that interests you?
What do you think are the most important qualities for a dentist to have?
How do you plan to stay current with new advances and technologies in dentistry throughout your career?

A patient comes into your practice with significant caries involvement. You find out whilst conversing that they do not use fluoride toothpaste as they read online that charcoal toothpaste whitens teeth and is less toxic. How would you encourage this patient to improve their oral health?

You are a dentist with a patient who has dental pain. After examination you cannot determine the causation of the pain without taking a radiograph and you suggest this to the patient. She refuses and says she believes radiographs are bad and will negatively impact her health. What do you do?
A patient has come in and is HIV-positive, your nurse REFUSES to treat him how would you treat this patient?
A patient with severe anxiety comes into your practice. Every time you approach them with a drill they panic and refuse to open their mouth. How would you manage the patient?
A heavy drug user and a respected council representative are in need of dental care however you only have time to treat one. Who would you treat and why?
You overhear a senior dental professor speak about patient details to a colleague and hear them make fun of the patient. What would you do in this situation?

Your practice manager (dentist) has not been coming to work consistently and you have had to work overtime to cover their shifts. They tell you they are suffering from depression. How will you deal with this situation?
You are struggling with your first exam in dentistry. Your friend knows this and sends you the leaked exam paper for the semester. What do you do in this situation?

On your first day as a foundation dentist you are told to do a procedure you have never done before. Your boss says that this is an easy procedure and you shouldn't struggle ; what do you do in this situation?

A patient comes into your practice for a regular checkup. As you are probing their tooth you accidentally expose their pulp. Because of this the patient now needs to get a root canal treatment or extraction. What would you do in this situation?
You have told your long time friend that you would take them out to dinner but you have been called in for an emergency appointment 5 minutes before you need to leave. Break the news.
You have just received results from a biopsy of a patient confirming your fears that they have oral cancer. Break the news to the Patient
You have to break the news to a patient that you their hamster has to have their leg amputated due to a complication during surgery.
Explain to an 83 year old person how to book tickets online for a culinary class in London.
You have to explain how to tie your shoelaces to a 20 year old that as never tied their shoes before.
You are late for work and drive off your driveaway without looking at your mirrors. You hear a crunch and realise you have just killed your neighbourâ€™s dog. Break the news to the neighbour.
You have told your best friend that you would take them out to Hakkasan but you have been called in for an emergency appointment 5 minutes before you need to leave. Break the news.
Make and explain an oral hygiene regime to a 6 year old
Explain to someone who has never been in a kitchen how to make a cup of tea with 2 sugars
What is your favourite movie or tv show?
What is your favourite book?
How do you deal with stress?
Who is the most important member of the dental team?
How many pennies can you fit in your room?
Compare and contrast NHS v Private dentistry
How do you think others would describe you?
Tell me a situation where you had to deal with a difficult person
Tell me a situation where you showed manual dexterity skills
How many coffees are consumed in the UK per day?
Why is a tennis ball fuzzy?
What is the most important thing you have learned in your life?

A windowless room has 3 lightbulbs, You are outside the room with 3 switches. One switch controls each lightbulb. You can only enter the room once. How do you determine which switch controls which lightbulb?
Computer Science: Can you tell us about your motivation for pursuing a career in computer science?
Data Structures: Explain the difference between a linked list and an array.
Algorithms: What is the time complexity of bubble sort and how can it be improved?
Operating Systems: What is a process and what is a thread?
Computer Networks: Explain the OSI model and the role of each layer.
Databases: What is ACID in the context of databases?
Programming: Can you explain the concept of object-oriented programming and provide an example?
Computer Architecture: Explain the Von Neumann architecture and its limitations.
Artificial Intelligence: What is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning?
Software Engineering: Can you describe the software development life cycle?
Theoretical Computer Science: What is the halting problem and why is it unsolvable?
How do you stay current with the latest trends and advancements in computer science, and what resources do you use for research and learning?
Finally, what do you see as the biggest challenges facing computer science, and how do you plan to address them in your future career?
What is your approach to problem solving, and how do you determine the best algorithms to use in a given situation?
What do you think are the ethical implications of using computer technology in our daily lives?
How do you think the computer science field can help address the issue of online misinformation and fake news?
How do you think we can address the issue of privacy and security in the digital world?
Tell me about binary searches. What about their efficiency? What are the tradeoffs?
What is the difference between a hash table and a binary search tree?
What is the difference between a stack and a queue?
What happens when light has to pass through a medium denser than air?

Monkey beans.  An urn contains 23 white beans and 34 black beans. A monkey takes out two beans; if they are the same, he puts a black bean into the urn, and if they are different, he puts in a white bean from a large heap he has next to him. The monkey repeats this procedure until there is only one bean left. What colour is it?
What role do you think computer science should play in addressing global challenges such as climate change or economic inequality?
Can you give an example of a greedy algorithm?
Can you explain the difference between a sorting algorithm that is time complexity O(n^2) and one that is time complexity O(n log n)?
Can you discuss the basics of cryptography and the most commonly used encryption algorithms?
Can you discuss the relationship between number theory and cryptography in computer science?
Can you discuss the basics of computer security and the most common threats to computer systems?
How do you think set theory and mathematical functions are used in computer algorithms and data structures?
Can you discuss the role of probability and statistics in machine learning and artificial intelligence?
What is the Church-Turing thesis and how does it relate to the theory of computation?
What is the theory of computation and why is it important in computer science?
Discuss the different types of complexity classes, including P, NP, NP-hard, and NP-complete.
What is the difference between a recursive and an iterative approach to solving a problem?
What is the difference between a post-order and in-order traversal in a binary tree?
If you had to choose, which data structure would you use to store and retrieve a large number of items: arrays or linked lists? Why?
How many computers can you fit into an empty room?
What is the most challenging project you have ever worked on and why?
How would you explain the concept of inheritance in object-oriented programming to a non-technical person?
How would you go about solving the tower of Hanoi problem?
